intro: Podandra cionophora, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants such as tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy, silver-gray leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are berries that turn from green to red as they mature. Podandra cionophora is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
